name: sfchronicle
text:
Tiger Woods, seeking the 16th major title of his career — and 83rd PGA Tour victory — kept himself in the hunt on Thursday, shooting a 2-under-par 68 during the first round of the PGA Championship. 

https://t.co/vh7maRzj0q

name: sfchronicle
text:
Golfer @TigerWoods’ surreal introduction punctuates strange scene at @PGAChampionship.

via @RonKroichick: https://t.co/O1by03yQcE

name: sfchronicle
text: COVID-19 test results from the state-run site at the Napa Valley Expo are now delayed between 17 to 19 days, worse than seven to ten days last week, Napa County health officer Dr. Karen Relucio said Thursday. https://t.co/lLF1NMWftT

name: sfchronicle
text:
Barred from Harding Park, fans get creative to watch @PGAChampionship in SF.

@ScottOstler has more here: https://t.co/T5D0oZxTOq

name: sfchronicle
text:
A former high-ranking official at the SF Medical Examiner’s Office sues the city for wrongful termination, alleging he was fired after he refused to alter Jeff Adachi’s autopsy report on orders from City Administrator Naomi Kelly. 

via @DominicFracassa: https://t.co/gM01Tvif7y

name: sfchronicle
text:
“As soon as you walk in this building,” Trent Williams said of the 49ers’ facility, “the vibe is different.” 

https://t.co/W2zz5AqtGm

name: sfchronicle
text:
Houston Chronicle writer Chandler Rome talks about the fallout from the Astros scandal, and he and @SusanSlusser break down the big series between the division’s top two teams starting Friday at the Coliseum.

Listen to our A's Plus podcast: https://t.co/AgujpZkDwQ

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: California surpassed 10,000 total coronavirus deaths on Thursday, according to public health data reviewed by The Chronicle. As of Thursday evening, California reported 10,014 total COVID-19 deaths. https://t.co/wsoR4EFgSm

name: sfchronicle
text:
Eight new wolf puppies are now roaming the wilds of Lassen and Plumas counties, an indication that California’s only known wolf pack is thriving and likely to stay, according to the California Department of Fish and Wildlife.

Story by @pfimrite: https://t.co/Jmu93C1AAt

name: sfchronicle
text: Harding Park, San Francisco’s venerable municipal course, drew mostly positive reviews from the world’s best golfers after the opening day of the PGA Championship. https://t.co/exvXQ86OW2

name: sfchronicle
text:
Many Latino voters associate Joe Biden with “deporter in chief” Barack Obama. @MarielenaNILC & @joegarofoli discuss Biden's changes in approach to immigration during his 2020 bid.

It's All Political podcast: 

Apple > https://t.co/axYPLTzhI6
Spotify > https://t.co/lLkZnhRON1 https://t.co/UplnhguUUZ

name: sfchronicle
text: A deadly disease that causes hemorrhaging is sweeping through the deer population in California, including Bay Area counties where people have spotted drooling animals suffering from seizures and gripped by vomiting and diarrhea, wildlife vets say. https://t.co/2RhIMhZiS0

name: sfchronicle
text:
Herd immunity might sound like an attractive idea: Let coronavirus spread until enough people are immune that the pandemic is over. It doesn’t work. @erinallday explains.

Listen to our Fifth & Mission podcast:
Apple > https://t.co/93RDZRJXEL
Spotify > https://t.co/TkPZfVQD05 https://t.co/zQ5dh1aGBr

name: sfchronicle
text: Bryson DeChambeau has been crushing drives with such ferocity that he’s become the talk of the PGA Tour. Then during the first round of the PGA Championship, he actually crushed his driver. https://t.co/sC98MN30SO

name: sfchronicle
text:
Houston Chronicle writer Chandler Rome talks about the fallout from the Astros scandal, and he and @SusanSlusser break down the big series between the division’s top two teams starting Friday at the Coliseum.

Listen to our A's Plus podcast: https://t.co/Af174TEFbD

name: sfchronicle
text: If you’re ready to get out of the house, head to these waterfront restaurants offering spacious patios with gorgeous views, from Half Moon Bay to Marshall. https://t.co/6Lx3b29VNA

name: sfchronicle
text:
Feds investigating massive suspected Marin County Ponzi scheme involving dead real estate investor.

@MGafni has the full story here: https://t.co/09hnBZjFn7 https://t.co/JNkaeiIrXH

name: sfchronicle
text:
Spectators get creative at PGA tournament, California's coronavirus data meltdown, and Vallejo police continue to draw scrutiny.

Here's what you need to know to start your day: https://t.co/XMatXQBu7y https://t.co/wA465vbl4g

name: sfchronicle
text: Enjoy a night at the drive-in with a double-feature: Movies to Open Your Eyes, ‘Do the Right Thing’ and ‘Get Out.’ Complimentary tickets for the showing on Wednesday, August 12 at The West Wind Solano Drive-In are available to Chronicle Members. https://t.co/L5UVG1EJmK

name: sfchronicle
text:
Why pay San Francisco prices when the tech company boss says you can work remotely? Will the exodus of workers be followed by an exodus of companies — and tax dollars? Jennifer Stojkovic of @sfciti says it might.

Listen to our Fifth & Mission podcast: https://t.co/xhhtjvUfWN

name: sfchronicle
text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/6CV3T3pjzH

name: sfchronicle
text: A shooting Thursday night in Oakland killed one man and injured three others. https://t.co/w5DpZh5riO

name: sfchronicle
text: Milla Handley, the first woman winemaker to open a winery in her own name, died July 25 of COVID-19. https://t.co/qz96lQ5NrM

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @mgafni: Robin Schild invested $650k to Ken Casey’s real estate companies, enticed by the promised 9% returns.

After Casey’s death, he and other investors learned the SEC is investigating an alleged Ponzi scheme defrauding hundreds of millions of dollars
https://t.co/y6DDDkZHnc

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @hknightsf: My latest: It’s goodbye to @3FishStudios and many other beloved San Francisco small businesses that can’t keep paying the bills with no end to the #COVID19 pandemic in sight. We need more federal money and more closed streets so they can operate outside. https://t.co/9E2cmnruZZ

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @SFC_Culture: “What does it mean to be responsible, accountable, through this time? It is very much a work in progress.” In his latest column,  @mccalmanco talks to @joseybakerbread about feeding community during coronavirus. https://t.co/4yOr9uLalf

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @pfimrite: California's only known wolf pack is thriving with eight new pups and a new papa wolf.  https://t.co/7T9SeOpF98

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @SFChronicleFood: Intimate omakase restaurants are planning ahead, even without an indoor dining timeline. One restaurant has already spent $7,000 on transparent barriers.
https://t.co/6sjTCnEnim

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @JanelleBitker: The very features that made omakase restaurants so popular are making it impossible for them to reopen safely. But that hasn't stopped some chefs from planning. https://t.co/Uu9ZZOjbIX

name: sfchronicle
text: The founders of 3 Fish Studios — famous for its iconic prints of the 49 Mile Drive’s seagull and a bear cradling the state of California, among others — are leaving the city. https://t.co/sDtXHgvYmA

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @SFC_Datebook: If you’re navigating through this seemingly endless coronavirus pandemic alone, you are not really alone.

"Going it Alone" explores issues single people are dealing with during this time.

via @BRFilmsAllen https://t.co/qWk0XKmDxf

name: sfchronicle
text: Since the onset of the pandemic, Gov. Gavin Newsom has said the state’s response would be guided by data. Now, a lack of accurate data has thrown that response into limbo. https://t.co/2D4df1dwFM

name: sfchronicle
text: California’s new Homekey program will dish out $100 million to convert Bay Area hotels and motels into permanent homeless housing. https://t.co/xbITAGYbrm

name: sfchronicle
text: The SEC initiated its investigation on May 28. An SEC spokeswoman declined to comment. https://t.co/e27hiIN6Kn

text: “We definitely on a monthly basis were spending much more than we were taking in,” Rewitzer said. “How long can you expect to go on?” https://t.co/DYOFYmUKPb

 https://t.co/Vs3bhyPNWl

text: JUST IN: Schools across New York can reopen for in-person instruction this fall, Gov. Andrew Cuomo said Friday. https://t.co/McTSp8Rycu

text: Within the first week of Season 5’s release, Laney’s athletics site boasted more than 250,000 visitors spanning nearly 30 countries. https://t.co/sR8vg45zio

name: sfchronicle
text: At San Francisco General Hospital, where 29 sworn deputies are assigned, an internal debate has been brewing between some Black staff who protest deputies’ use of force and other nurses who say they depend on deputies for their own safety. https://t.co/CvaptY0DSK

name: sfchronicle
text: An Air India Express flight with 190 people on board skidded off a runway and split in two while landing Friday in heavy rain in southern India. Police said at least 14 people were killed and 123 others injured. https://t.co/q106D95V54

name: sfchronicle
text: Sorry SF, but Tiger Woods hates the Giants. https://t.co/c8l5RiWVR7

name: sfchronicle
text: A Black midwife, supported by some employees of color, has been on strike for a month to protest the deputies’ presence and the trauma she said she has experienced because of them. https://t.co/RMiUJ557cv

name: sfchronicle
text: U.S. deaths from COVID-19 are expected to number almost 300,000 by December, nearly doubling the toll over the next four months, according to new data released Friday. https://t.co/sMCmMMVyw7

name: sfchronicle
text: The elaborate setup features slots that can slide open and close, allowing the chef to drop a piece of nigiri on a platform in front of the diner. Meanwhile, tall barriers can glide between diners to separate different-size parties. https://t.co/AQJ2QNyaCk

name: sfchronicle
text: Democratic leaders said Friday that the White House rejected an offer for a roughly $2 trillion coronavirus relief package, The Hill reports. https://t.co/xOiGLfTYsv

name: sfchronicle
text: “There are a large number of cases that haven’t been reported to us, and those are cases we haven’t been able to properly investigate. It’s frustrating and very upsetting for us.” https://t.co/8bm83v1IoU

name: sfchronicle
text: A union representing thousands of California prison employees is suing the state corrections department and its health care system, charging that officials are exposing staffers to “uncontrolled” coronavirus outbreaks. https://t.co/n0imeqzJaE

name: sfchronicle
text: A federal judge ordered immigration officials to test all detainees for the coronavirus at a Bakersfield facility where COVID-19 has broken out and to report test results quickly. https://t.co/dD5E9qlNzW

via @MusicSF  https://t.co/A2kZpWQEvL

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @ScottStrazzante: Benny Cook lies on the grass during a back up on the 16th tee during 2nd round of @PGAChampionship at TPC Harding Park in San Francisco, Calif., on Friday, August 7, 2020. name: sfchronicle
text: Former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid said Friday that President Trump “is raising concerns that are non-existent” by attacking plans for mail-in voting during the pandemic, including in Reid’s home state of Nevada. https://t.co/VhDLmStuf2

name: sfchronicle
text: Dr. Anthony Fauci says Americans can go to voting booths in person if they’re careful, the Washington Post reports. https://t.co/9Vbiy59JoB

name: sfchronicle
text: SF teachers were required to work only 4 hours a day during the school shutdown in the spring. Under the tentative new deal for distance learning, teachers would provide 2 hours of live instruction a day, and return to 7-hour workdays. https://t.co/i2hX3nyZOC
